Package authoring

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • authoring.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class represents the user interface for the authoring program. It is responsible for creating all the user interface panels. In order to create a new authoring session, simply create a (single) instance of this class.
    Since:
    2017-03-15
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dilshad Khatri, Alvis Koshy, Drew Noel, Jonathan Tung
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI()
        Create a new default authoring GUI. Accepts no arguments, and runs until the UI is closed.

    • Method Detail

      • upd

        public void upd()

      • setAudioThread

        public void setAudioThread​(ThreadRunnable audioThread)
        Set the value of the audio thread in order for the main thread to access it and run various methods on it.
        Parameters:
        audioThread - The instance of the audio thread that the GUI should attempt to control

      • getAudioThread

        public ThreadRunnable getAudioThread()
        Retrieve the last known instance of the audio thread. In the even that there was never a known instance, this will return null.
        Returns:
        Either the last known instance (if it exists) or null (otherwise).

      • getLeftPanel

        public LeftPanel getLeftPanel()
        Obtain the shared reference to the Left Panel. The Left Panel contains the backend list which is both shown to the authoring user (as a text list) and used for generating the final output file (via serialization)
        Returns:
        The single instance of the left panel

      • getRightPanel

        public RightPanel getRightPanel()
        Obtain the shared reference to the Right Panel. The Right Panel contains the buttons for the authoring user to control the application
        Returns:
        The single instance of the right panel

      • getSettingsPanel

        public SettingsPanel getSettingsPanel()
        Obtain the shared reference to the Settings Panel. The Settings Panel contains the values which are used to generate the output file header information
        Returns:
        The single instance of the settings panel

      • resetCounter

        public void resetCounter()
        Resets the counter for each function.
